caption: I made reservations for my boyfriend’s birthday. We got there and the waiter never even introduced himself, I told the waiter it was my bf’s birthday, and asked if we could get some plates for the cake that I brought, he said “sure! No problem!” So my bestie and I walk outside, smoke a cig, put candles in the cake, walked back inside, got to the table, lit the candles and started singing! It was awesome, check the pic! Then, what I assume was some kinda manager, informed us that we couldn’t eat the cake in the restaurant. We had a $400 tab... $400 dollars! There was literally 2 other parties near us, one was 3 adults and a baby, the other was a couple outside. I know it’s a little silly to get upset that they completely rained on our parade; we asked ahead about  the cake and then get “scolded” and quite frankly I was embarrassed, after dropping $400 on subpar food and drinks, at the very least I thought we could sing happy birthday   and eat a slice of cake. Or perhaps they could have comped a round of drinks? I don’t know, they left a bad taste in my mouth...

I went there with two other friends, so three of us had food for about 130 dollars, but the total bill came to $185 WITHOUT the tip. I found out that it automatically added 10% tax (can't do anything about it) and 30% SERVICE CHARGE FOR THREE PEOPLE... And I had to tip on top of that.... We ended up paying over 200 dollars.... RIDICULOUS.....  And the food wasn't all the impressive.  Not going back there every again..
Mediocre food. Their heaters don’t work and they charge 20% service fee even if you end up taking food to your car.
Not really what I expected from the pix online, and not toddler friendly since they didn't have high chairs.
Forst time here- Great service. Delicious food.

Absolutely delicious charbroiled oysters. Britt my server recommended a wine that paired perfectly. The chef welcomed questions and accommodated me when I requested carryout chowder that would last a few days.  Couldn't ask for better service. Went above and beyond for me. I'm sure would do the same for everyone. Please support restaurants and their server's during covid-19.
Fast service. Amazing oysters from the York river.
Loved this place, however the opening hours are not updated on the google page. Commuted to the wharf guided by the google information and found out it was closed.
Love this place! Excellent food, service, and covid precautions!
Fantastic oysters, incredibly fresh. Friendly staff.

The service was amazing, and the food was delicious. I loved the whipped Feta dip, and my boyfriend all but inhaled his oyster po boy. They have what seems to possibly be a limited menu due to covid, but what they do have is great.
The oyster stew was very good, but there were too many French fries for the number of fried shrimp & fried oysters we received. Way too expensive for what we received.

Pretty limited menu, but good service. The food was, for the most part, good. The only thing that could be better, in my opinion, is the flavor. A little more spice/seasoning wouldn't hurt. The oyster shooters and cocktails are recommended. The oyster bisque was unique as well.
Live goid services
Must haves: Pink and Pretty Cocktail! Crab Cake Sandwich!!!
Came here for lunch and the food I had was good.
Delicious oysters, great drinks, and fast and friendly service. The hostess was kind and gracious.

Slowwwwwww service, food was subpar.  I ordered the catfish sandwich when I finallllly got it it was cold and sooooo soggy 🤢 Fries were good, peel and eat shrimp pound looked like maybe half a pound...eh.
Well, first time here for raw oysters and we were not impressed! We went down to Hanks and the oysters and service was much better
Fried oysters were tiny, raw oysters were flavorless and fried shrimp was overcooked. Insanely overpriced for sub par food and lack luster service.

The food is really bad... I had a shrimp po boy that taste like mop water and there are only two people working in the restaurant. My girlfriend and I were not permitted to take photos and just did not enjoy our experience.
Great experience, a bit pricey and parking is a challenge.
The food was very good as was the service.   A little more expensive.
Excellent oysters, and service!
Great lunch spot.

This is one of our favorite happy hour spots in the city. Rappahannock river oysters are my absolute favorites on the planet, so that's a big plus! Aside from the discounted oysters, the other happy specials are equally great, along with the wine and beer pairings. For the Wharf, it's hard to beat, especially with a nice view of the water and East Potomac Park.

Gone there twice around 9-930pm recently. Both times they’ve had a chalkboard sign outside that says they’re open until 12am...both times all their doors have been locked and no one has let us in (even with us waving through the window). Walked to the bar next door with other groups both times. Really feels like they want to close early every night. The one time I went I thought the drinks and food were great so it’s unfortunate that we never seem to be able to go back. ¯_(ツ)_/¯
Great service. The local craft beers on tap were excellent. So we're the oysters and the chowder. Looking forward to visiting again on my next trip
The bartenders here are everything. Sit at the bar. Ask about the backyard wedding and bad movies
The best place

Their food was mostly good. A little overpriced, but it's the wharf area. I was admittedly a little disappointed by their charbroiled oysters. I get that it's their take, but if you're missing Felix's or Acme, you'll have to look elsewhere or make your own.
Excellent food and atmosphere- the staff is courteous and accommodating.  I would highly recommend.  You must try their lunch specials.
Great customer service.
The food was delicious!
Wish that they had a larger menu.

Go to the wharf! Wow. Nice experience. Bar is typical crowded place. Service was good. Food was very flavorful. Chowder is heavy smokey, delicious. Scallops were amazing with sun chokes instead of potatoes. Charbroiled oysters were good but not remarkable. I'll go here again when in town.
The seared scallops were fantastic! First time for sunchokes and I loved them. This plate paired well with the first sparkling wine on the list.  My companion loved the smokey oyster chowder.
They grow their own oysters. I wish they haven't removed the grilled squid from their menu
Amazing oysters and Nice IPA. Inviting atmosphere and friendly staff.
Fun place to eat a few oysters and drink some champagne

It's an oyster bar and the rest weren't too impressive. The oysters we had were fine, but our later visit to Old Ebbitt the oysters were much better and not too much more expensive. The burger was underwhelming. The pan seared scallops was very well done though.
Great oysters
Great food for concert pregaming

The seared scallops were perfectly cooked and presented. Other small plates were also done very well. Half she'll oysters also very good. Price is reasonable for seafood and the service was very good. Menu not very big though.
Great dishes.  And bartender, John was awesome and interesting.

Good oysters in a nice setting. Menu is simple and straightforward, which is a positive thing. Prices are Wharf-appropriate, which is higher than some seafood places elsewhere in the city and lower than others, but hey, they've got to afford the location somehow. Definitely worth a visit if you're craving oysters or other tasty seafood.
Hands down best oysters in the city!!!
Great food excellent service I just love their oysters
I was impressed.  Their crabcake was good.
Great service and great seafood
Excellent food and sevice. Well worth the money.
Absolutely love this place! Maye makes the best drinks at the bar. Erich is an awesome server, oysters were delicious what more can I ask for
Good food but small menu.  Beer choices were also pretty limited.
The oysters were simply delicious! A must visit when I return.
Not what I expected but excellent burger!

Late lunch yesterday (Saturday) was excellent. We lucked out and snagged a couple seats at the bar. Ambiance and music were great. We had drinks, a crab cake sandwich, and a fried oysters/shrimp basket. Everything was spot on, fresh, and well-seasoned. We have been coming to the Wharf for years and this spot exceeded our expectations. I appreciated that their crab cake was mostly crab and not breading/fillers like many other restaurants. The servers/bartenders were on point and were like a well oiled machine. Will definitely be back!

Side dishes dressed greens was delicious and a big portion. I would have loved some shaved carrots and more veggies in it but that is just me. Garlic old bay fries were good but didn't have much garlic or old bay flavor to them. Good wait staff and not crowded compared to the other restaurants. That is part of the reason for choosing it too.

Came here tonight for anniversary dinner. Had the crab cake sandwich and my wife had the shrimp fry basket. I enjoyed the sandwich however i had old bay with a side of fries. The shrimp was also heavily seasoned. Those things are okay and i still would have given the place five stars, as we enjoyed the ambience and music. What we didn't like was that our server seemed to pay attention to us less and more so to tables around us. From the time that he dropped off the food until we were checked on and then ordered dessert was at least 25 minutes. However,  he checked on the 4 person table in front of us 4 times and the couple behind us 3 times. We were in the same area however we were checked on less. Im not saying it was a racial thing but we were definitely not enthused with the service. I feel that an annoyingly attentive waiter is better than someone who picks and chooses who to joke and laugh with and who to pass by. It leaves a bad taste in my mouth. I probably won't come back.
The salads are amazing with the shallots for the entree.
Went for the happy hour, oysters are well priced and some of the best french fries I've ever had.
Good food A little pricey but worth it.
Great location--fun place, fab food!

Rappahannock Oyster Bar at the Wharf was amazing. They had messed up our order, but had it fixed immediately. The Charred Oysters were delicious and the fried shrimp were battered spot on! I would recommend they season the boiled shrimp more or give you some seasoning with the dish. Overall amazing amazing!
Food was delicious. Oysters taste so fresh. I will be back
Delicious oysters in a great waterfront area.
Fried Shrimp was good. Staff needs to be attentive. Ordered Fries without old bay, yet they added it. The little details matter.
False Advertising. Branzino on website, not on menu. Menu has been pared down to typical bar food. Awful that the best thing is the RAR and the fries. #disappointed

I live at The Wharf and have been to all the restaurants. Rappahannock no longer allows pets on the outdoor patio, unlike all the other restaurants. The ambience is great inside (outside you can sometimes smell the fish market). The oysters are good, but I would still say they're better at Hank's. Service is subpar, but it seems to be managed well. Overall, I would pick most Wharf restaurants over this one.

We had the BEST experience at the warf location with Zee as a waitress. She was so knowledgeable and assisted in the BEST Experience we could ever imagine!!!!! Thank you for the most enjoyable  experience we could've ever asked for!!!
Hostess needs training on treating people.  Little Mrs attitude.  I felt the waitress was doing me a favor for waiting on me.  However food was excellent.
Love this place!  Small - you either eat outside or if you're lucky, get seats at the bar.  Raw bar is fantastic, but their other offerings are also delicious!  Highly recommend!
My son ordered a shrimp basket and there was a thick hair on the last shrimp. Food was overpriced for the amount of food received. Menu choices are very limited.

Service: We came here on a Saturday night excited for seafood. We arrived at 9:20pm and the more experienced hostess informed us that there would be a 20 minute wait or less and would text as soon as a table opened. My boyfriend asked if she would prefer us wait nearby or if we were able to walk around the waterfront. She reassuringly told us that walking around wouldn't be a problem. 30 minutes in, we came back to check if something opened up thinking that a table would be opened soon. We stood across from the restaurant waiting and saw a couple arrive and immediately get seated. Confused, my boyfriend asked the hostess if something was mixed up or if they arrived before us since its been well past 20 mins. She looked up with an annoyed look and asked "Are you sure you were on the waiting list? Because I don't see anything". My boyfriend pulled out his phone and showed her the wait list confirmation that was sent at 9:20pm. She rolled her eyes and told us that "According to her list, our confirmation was canceled by us at 9:39pm" When we showed her the screen, she saw that clearly that did not happen. With a clear look on her face she then said, "Well i can look and see".  Food: When we finally got seated, we decided to order one of each of the oysters and clams, the scallop carpaccio, the fry oyster basket, and the grilled squid. The oysters and clams were delicious and the scallop carpaccio was one of the best. The fry oyster basket was decent and the grilled squid was fine. For dessert we had the banana pudding, which was excellent.  Overall the food was pretty good, but not amazing enough to justify waiting unnecessarily long, rolled eyes, and undeserved attitude when we were more than happy to understand that mistakes happen.

It was good. I had never had oysters before, so it was interesting. I think the place should be bigger because it made me feel like I was suffocating and I'm not even claustrophobic. The bathrooms are very pretty.
Good food, but small servings for the price! Service was just okay.
Great bar great oysters great food
The Service is so good, and the Oysters were amazing
Great local oyster bar. Crab cake sandwich was awesome. Fun active bar scene watching the staff shuck oysters.
Great place and the oysters are superb!.
Great food, service, location. Next time in DC will definitely come back
Nah.

Frist time here, the crab cake was delicious! As soon as we got to the entrance a lady in a dress and sneakers immediately told us the patio was closed and was uninviting maybe because of the heat. We didnt know if she worked there, when we asked to see the menu she seemed irritated and I'm not sure why. Not a great first impression of the level of service from a restaurant. I wish people would be a little friendlier especially with customer service in the food industry. Our server seemed like serving us was just a drag compared to serving others. It doesnt matter if the food was good the service was not the best and I would come again but not to this one!
Nice stop for lunch near the water.  Scallops and crab cake sandwich are both delicious! The cocktails were OK.

I love everything about this place. First of all, location. The old DC fish market has always been my favorite spot due to its incredible seafood and authenticity. Second, their excellent oysters. They are farm raised, so they are good all year round including summer months. Finally, their non-oyster menu is equally delicious and delicate.
Had a nice lunch here today. Good ambience sitting around the bar with a view of the wharf. The crab salad was delicious.
Good food a bit pricey.

Great oysters and champagne.  Ruined by the rude bar staff, inparticular the barman with the blonde pony tail who did nothing all night bar be abrupt to the clients! If you're the owner, i'd suggest you review your staff!
Great food and service.
Tasty oysters and nice atmosphere! We also had the shrimp to peel, good taste but not that special!
Great Service Friendly staff
Shrimp PO boy is amazing! Rochambeau oysters are divine as well!

If I could give 0 stars I would! Terrible service! Or NO service I'd say! No one came up to us we had to complain and get the manager to get oir order. Tje Oysters were not fresh at alll! Total disappointment!
Been on the hunt dor some great oysters and their Rochambeaux are the best. Also John, the bartender, was great. Professional, cool, and a great mixologist.

Absolutely poor service. We (four women- three black with natural hair and one white) were seated fairly quickly. Unfortunately, we were never served. We sat and waited for about 20 mins before asking a server if he knew who ours was. He looked confused and said he would find them. Another 10 mins later, no one had served us. I asked to speak to the manager who was apologetic but seemed indifferent to our experience. It was happy hour and a nice day, but half of the tables were full and there was plenty of staff serving the other patrons. The menu was interesting and were we’re excited to go there, but will never return due to how we were treated.
Best crab cake in DC.

We did Rappahannock and Hanks (nearby) in the same afternoon. In our view, Hanks is much better.  We found the Rappahannock’s prices to be higher, portions to be smaller and quality to be comparable. The atmosphere was also not much to our liking, as it felt a bit pretentious.

Sat at bar with family for late dinner... nice atmosphere, good quick service. Clam chowder was awesome. Burger and crab cakes were good. The oysters, however... being from Florida I’m not keen on paying $2.50 each for plain old oysters. A little pricy, but I would go again if nearby.

We got lucky and snagged a seat at the bar right away. It’s a bit more raucous with commotion and drinks being made, but the view out the windows is nice. We got the sampler platter with all the oysters, clams, shrimp, etc. Some of the best we’ve had. The Scallop Carpaccio was incredible!
The aesthetics of this oyster bar are on point. The service here was great and our waiter made sure that our needs were met. This is a good place for happy hour!
Bartender John ... Awesome. Whole fish delish.
Great clam chowder and oysters.

4 Stars the Manager who heard what I said loud and clear and made it right- what I said was: "He's bad at what he does" He being the bartender yesterday, who was short, rude and unprofessional when questioned about anything at all.  I know customer service, I live and breath customer service, if you do not like ALL people, or pressure, don't get into a high pressure job where people are around.  It takes more than making drinks to be a good bartender/host, you have to have a personality that accepts ALL people. Thanking the manager again, the second manager, who had to ring us out because the bartender pretty much ignored us after we'd asked too many questions, the first manager we met was just as short and rude as short as the bartender.

Great for oysters. Beware the burgers which are cooked leather-hard (we were not asked how we wanted them cooked). Crab sandwiches were lackluster: bun not toasted, little seasoning beyond salt). Shrimp by the half-pound was tasty. Green salad was very good. Super-friendly service, but our table of 11 was missing a place setting and water.
The atmosphere was very nice. The food was too expensive, not to my liking and the menu does not give many choices. To each his/her own.
amazing oysters, staff could use some more smiling in their lives
An All ways changing menu of awesome

Pros: Nice view of the fish market. Sitting at the bar, you can watch as oysters are shucked before your eyes! Reasonable prices, but on the upscale end. We got a variety platter and liked everything.  Cons: Despite beating the lunch crowd (11:30am), service was slow. Not a lot of indoor seating. It shows around the edges that this used to be a literal shack.

The fried basket was over salted and a very small portion for the price, the oysters were nice and fresh. The waiter was lovely but the outside hostess was not so welcoming, not a  good way to greet patrons.
Love....love this place...great staff...gotta love seafood😁
Ok

We came for a late Saturday night dinner and the restaurant was super busy - we waited about 40 minutes which wasn't terrible for The Wharf. There were 4 of us, and they seated us at an odd bar-style table jutting out of the oyster bar - it was not conducive for conversations at all. The oysters and scallop carpaccio we ordered for an app were very delicious and fresh. The chowder here is also delicious as it has a kick, and is different from your typical chowder. The rest of our food was extremely subpar and inconsistent. The shrimp was just ok - several of my shrimp's textures were a bit mushy, meaning the shrimp wasn't fresh. The crabcake sandwich was extremely underwhelming. We really liked the fries that came with the crabcake sandwich were very good and crispy so we ordered another side order. The side order that came, the fries were soggy and stuck together - we had to order another one. We also ordered a side salad - portion was generous here. On top of the food, service was also very subpar. The hosts are quite curt, especially when you go back to check in on wait status. Our server looked like she hated her job - she never smiled, she didn't laugh when we tried to make jokes, and didn't apologize when our fries had to be replaced. Not sure we would come back here.
Had a bunch of oysters and white whine - all perfect and cold, served by nice staff!

Extremely small portions for the price. Got the shrimp Po Boy and got about 4 shrimp on a tiny sandwich for $22. Also extremely loud amd rowdy. Do not sit at bar unless you are planning on being drunk and extremely loud. Would never visit again.
Great food

(Translated by Google) Delicious👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 All the seafood is fresh ~ The oyster service staff at the counter has not stopped! Favorite Crispy whole fish, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, the meat is delicious and delicious. I would like to come here again for food! !! !!  (Original) Delicious👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 海鮮全部都很新鮮唷～ 吧台現開生蠔的服務人員手沒停過！ 最愛Crispy whole fish🤤外皮酥脆裡面肉質細嫩鮮美超讚👏🏻會想要為了美食再來這！！！
Pricey but, hey, it's the wharf.

Absolutely amazing. I love the setting, atmosphere, staff, and most importantly, the oysters. I’ve never tasted oysters so good and the man shucking them made certain they were done perfectly without a single bit of shell in the oyster. I can’t wait to come back, the best meal I had in DC.

(Translated by Google) The location is very close to the cherry blossoms. The meals are delicious and fresh. The environment is comfortable. It should be a place that locals like to visit. Watch out for you and find a lot of familiar faces on TV. The two of the neighboring tables are 😉  (Original) 离看樱花🌸的地点很近，餐点都好吃又新鲜😋，环境舒适，应该是当地人很喜欢光顾的地方，留意一下你周围，会发现很多在电视上看到的熟悉面孔，和我们邻桌的两位就是呢😉
Stuff are friendly. Amazing local oysters. Fish of day is the must have.
Great food, wonderful cocktails, and a nice warm atmosphere.
Try the raw bar! Fresh!
Good service friendly staff
The oysters were wonder. The beer cold. A gin and tonic cost 14 dollars. Pretty pricy.
The one place in DC we liked enough to go back to again before we left. Didn't even know I liked raw oysters before I came here, but I guess I do!
Great ambiance! I got the fish of the day, my favorite Branzino, and it was delicious!! Service was great! Oysters are nice and fresh! I would highly recommend Rappahannock!! 🔥

This is our go-to lunch spot at work. Our fav bar tender knows when we are coming and is ready! The food is really delish! The Crab balls are out of this world...haven't had something I don't like! The oyster chowder is original and really good too! The unique, historic building is set like a glass garage with a lovely outdoor seating area! The drinks are right!
Great spot for Oysters at the wharf
Outstanding EVERYTHING IS THE BEST OF THE BEST!
Great food had a blast good cocktails and even better seafood ,,,highly recommend very       Intimate Placed To be with great Service Near my date had A-blast

If you like oysters, you will like this place. Although there are some items on the menu that are not from the Sea (and they are very good)...this place is seafood centric.  Good cocktails and a beer and wine list to match. Only about 20 barside seats on the inside of the building with the rest of the seats outside on the patio. If there is inclimate weather the patio will be closed and those barside seats are all that are available. Parking is expensive if you do not have the patience to search the surrounding streets or a desire to walk a few blocks.
It was so good. I am from out of town and this was one of my top places I would visit again!!

Came in for happy hour specials, had a really great time. At least in winter it simply can't hold too many people, so there was a good staff to guest ratio. It was nice sitting near the oyster bar and be able to talk to the sous chef prepping them
Wonderful spot down at the wharf.  The staff is wonderful.  Friendly and attentive.  Totally exceeded expectations.
Axesome place thx a lot !!
Great oysters, friendly staff. Definitely going back.

Their grilled oysters were superb, and the atmosphere was unique (we sat at the bar and got to watch how the oysters were prepared). Overall the service was top class (my glass of water was promptly refilled every time it got low), but our order came way after the order of others that came after us (similar dish) and the main server did not check on us until we asked if something had happened to our meal.

Came in for lunch and had a hard time leaving. Got the chowder and burger combo. The chowder was off the charts delicious. Tons of clams and that Breton bacon was the perfect accent. The burger was juicy and perfectly cooked. Our delightful bartender (sorry, I can't remember her name) recommended the banana pudding for dessert. I left, a nicely full and very happy guest. This will not be my last time here!
Best oysters I’ve had in DC

Good music, nice ambiance, and tasty oysters. Indoors, there are seats around the bar. Outdoors there are tables under heat lamps. HH is inside and outside until 6pm. Pics include the oyster po boy and cheeseburger.

This place is awesome.  The food is divine.  It started out over at Union Market and has expanded over to include its new, fabulous, Wharf location in the old, historic oyster shed.  They have created a beautiful space, with great food and cocktails.  But - don’t go!  I want it to myself!!!  Cheerios!
I went late night and the service was great. The staff was really nice and the food was delicious!
